private_information: I specialize in analyzing action schemas that manipulate next relations for objects.
I have local visibility on a subset of objects and the intended low-level parameter roles in plans.
manipulator_a.goal: Analyze the action descriptions and produce a clear structured model of preconditions and effects for the actions that touch the subset of objects I see.

private_information: I specialize in analyzing action schemas that create or remove vase and collect relations and that interact with stupendous and spring attributes.
I have a complementary subset view of objects and may observe different object indices than manipulator_a.
manipulator_b.goal: Analyze the action descriptions and produce a clear structured model of preconditions and effects for the actions that touch the subset of objects I see.

private_information: I aggregate structured action models from domain specialists into a coherent causal plan graph and detect ordering constraints between actions.
I work on producing an actionable, solver-oriented model but I do not emit the final PDDL domain and problem by myself.
planner.goal: Combine the analyses from manipulators into an integrated causal/temporal model and produce a partial model that records action templates, object typing, and necessary ordering constraints.

private_information: I audit temporal and causal consistency, detect bookkeeping shortcuts such as quota tokens or post-hoc penalties, and suggest eliminations or explicit encodings instead of shortcuts.
I flag ambiguous object renamings and recommend canonical names and explicit collection invariants.
auditor.goal: Provide a report that removes bookkeeping shortcuts and enforces temporal and causal soundness so the final integrated model is clean and compatible with planners that require explicit state changes.

private_information: I coordinate the inputs from the manipulators, planner, and auditor to produce the final PDDL domain and problem targeted at the FastDownwards solver.
I must keep actions distinct across agents and ensure the final encoding is solver-ready and self-contained.
orchestrator.goal: Produce a complete PDDL domain and PDDL problem that encode the actions, initial state, and goals so that the FastDownwards planner can be run to solve the tasks.

public_information: Six action schemas are available: paltry, sip, clip, wretched, memory, tightfisted. Each action has specific preconditions and effects over predicates hand, cats, texture, vase, next, sneeze, spring, collect, stupendous.
paltry requires hand X, cats Y, texture Z, vase X Y, next Y Z and makes next X Z true and vase X Y false.
sip requires hand X, cats Y, texture Z, next X Z, next Y Z and makes vase X Y true and next X Z false.
clip requires hand X, sneeze Y, texture Z, next Y Z, next X Z and makes vase X Y true and next X Z false.
wretched requires sneeze X, texture Y, texture Z, stupendous W, next X Y, collect Y W, collect Z W and makes next X Z true and next X Y false.
memory requires cats X, spring Y, spring Z, next X Y and makes next X Z true and next X Y false.
tightfisted requires hand X, sneeze Y, texture Z, next Y Z, vase X Y and makes next X Z true and vase X Y false.

Two distinct initial condition groups and two distinct goal groups are present in the use-case. The initial conditions include many facts like cats, collect, hand, next, sneeze, spring, stupendous, and texture over different object indices. The goals require establishing several next relations such as next object_10 object_8, next object_11 object_6, next object_12 object_8, next object_9 object_5 for the first scenario and other target next relations for the second scenario.
Agents must reason about object identity, canonical naming, and avoid implicit bookkeeping shortcuts. The orchestrator will produce a final PDDL encoding for FastDownwards.

analysis.system_prompt: You are a domain specialist analyzing action schemas. Provide a structured description of the preconditions and effects you can infer for the actions that concern your subset of objects. Do not emit PDDL. Return a clear mapping of action names to parameter roles, precondition lists, and effect lists and note any ambiguities or missing information.
analysis.prompt: Your name is manipulator_a. You see the public information {environment->public_information} and you have these private facts {agents->manipulator_a->private_information}. Your task is to produce a structured action model for the actions you can reason about, listing parameters, positive preconditions, negative preconditions if any, add effects and delete effects, and enumerating ambiguities that must be resolved for integration.

analysis.system_prompt: You are a domain specialist analyzing action schemas. Provide a structured description of the preconditions and effects you can infer for the actions that concern your subset of objects. Do not emit PDDL. Return a clear mapping of action names to parameter roles, precondition lists, and effect lists and note any ambiguities or missing information.
analysis.prompt: Your name is manipulator_b. You see the public information {environment->public_information} and you have these private facts {agents->manipulator_b->private_information}. Your task is to produce a structured action model for the actions you can reason about, listing parameters, positive preconditions, negative preconditions if any, add effects and delete effects, and enumerating ambiguities that must be resolved for integration.

model.system_prompt: You are a planner-level integrator. Merge the structured models from domain specialists into an integrated causal/temporal model. Do not output final PDDL domain or problem. Instead produce an intermediate model with typed action schemas, object typing suggestions, and ordering constraints suitable for conversion to PDDL by an orchestrator.
model.prompt: Your name is planner. You have access to the public information {environment->public_information} and to analyses {analysis_manipulator_a} and {analysis_manipulator_b}. Produce an integrated action model and a partial plan graph that records causal links and ordering constraints. Highlight unresolved ambiguities that need adjudication and provide recommended canonical object naming and type assignments.

audit.system_prompt: You are an auditor of temporal and causal consistency. Inspect the partial model for bookkeeping shortcuts such as implicit quota tokens, post-hoc penalties, or other non-explicit mechanisms. Replace such shortcuts with explicit state predicates or explicit resource encodings and provide corrective recommendations. Do not emit PDDL, but provide a clear, solver-friendly corrected model report.
audit.prompt: Your name is auditor. You receive {partial_model_planner} together with the public information {environment->public_information}. Identify any implicit bookkeeping or temporal shortcut, propose explicit encodings instead, and produce a corrected model description with recommended invariants and explicit predicates suitable for direct translation to PDDL by the orchestrator.

pddl.system_prompt: You are the orchestrator whose job is to produce a solver-ready PDDL domain and PDDL problem targeted at the FastDownwards planner. Use the integrated models and the auditor's corrections to construct a complete PDDL domain and a complete PDDL problem. Keep actions distinct and preserve agent-specific action names if they differ. Ensure the PDDL is compatible with FastDownwards requirements and include typing, requirements, and problem objects. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags.
pddl.prompt: You are orchestrator. You received analyses {analysis_manipulator_a} and {analysis_manipulator_b}, the planner model {partial_model_planner}, and the auditor report {audit_report}. Produce a final PDDL domain and a PDDL problem that encode the six action schemas, the provided initial facts, and the specified goals. Target the FastDownwards solver and ensure the output is self-contained and unambiguous. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags.
